title: Google\Cloud\Compute\V1\AddAssociationRegionNetworkFirewallPolicyRequest
name: AddAssociationRegionNetworkFirewallPolicyRequest
description:
A request message for RegionNetworkFirewallPolicies.AddAssociation. See the method description for details.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.compute.v1.AddAssociationRegionNetworkFirewallPolicyRequest

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.firewall_policy
params.description: Name of the firewall policy to update.

params.name: data.region
params.description: Name of the region scoping this request.

params.name: data.replace_existing_association
params.description: Indicates whether or not to replace it if an association already exists. This is false by default, in which case an error will be returned if an association already exists.

params.name: data.request_id
params.description: An optional request ID to identify requests. Specify a unique request ID so that if you must retry your request, the server will know to ignore the request if it has already been completed. For example, consider a situation where you make an initial request and the request times out. If you make the request again with the same request ID, the server can check if original operation with the same request ID was received, and if so, will ignore the second request. This prevents clients from accidentally creating duplicate commitments. The request ID must be a valid UUID with the exception that zero UUID is not supported ( 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000).

methods.name: getRequestId
methods.description:
An optional request ID to identify requests. Specify a unique request ID so that if you must retry your request, the server will know to ignore the request if it has already been completed. For example, consider a situation where you make an initial request and the request times out. If you make the request again with the same request ID, the server can check if original operation with the same request ID was received, and if so, will ignore the second request. This prevents clients from accidentally creating duplicate commitments. The request ID must be a valid UUID with the exception that zero UUID is not supported ( 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000).
